snippet: Former President Hosni Mubarak is likely to go free, denying justice for the hundreds who died in the 2011 uprising.
abstract: Editorial decries dismissal of all charges against former Egyptian Pres Hosni Mubarak; calls ruling a final insult to the hundreds of protesters who were killed in country's 2011 uprising; argues decision is another step back from a just society, and that instead of producing stability, it will only continue to stoke discontent and unrest.
lead_paragraph: Former President Hosni Mubarak is likely to go free, denying justice for the hundreds who died in the 2011 uprising.

headline.main: In Egypt, a Verdict Turns Back the Clock
headline.print_headline: In Egypt, a Verdict Turns Back the Clock

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
